The sun rises, and a small snake hungers. He'd like to eat, but doesn't really want to bother anyone.

# BITSY VERSION 3.4

! ROOM_FORMAT 1

PAL 0

SPR i

POS 4 9,14

DLG a
Woof! You can't eat me, for I am only a pup - you won't only eat my flesh, but all of my unlivened years. It's too much of a burden for such a small snake.

DLG e
You can't eat me, for I am already dead. Sorry, pal. Don't worry though: it's not so bad down there. 

DLG h
You can't eat me, but I promise that I'll feast on your flesh after you die. I won't forget you.

DLG i
Don't even think about it, little snake: I will tear your throat out if ever dare to bite me. I'm immortal. I'm King of this desert. And when Death comes for me, I will simply kill her.

DLG b
Hiss! You can't eat me, for I am like you: a creature of grins and scales, of green and teeth. We're cousins! And you wouldn't ever, ever eat family, would you?

DLG d
No, don't eat me, please! I'm starving anyway: in a day or two, I will be gone. But the stars are too beautiful to die tonight...

END 0
Hungry and tired, the small snake bites his own tail, thus becoming Ouroboros, master of time. "You can't make excuses for Death" he realizes, now enlightened "Eternity is not a personal choice". As he keeps devouring himself, circling over and over, he recalls everything...
